meanings.definition: Cause or arrange for (an event) to take place at a time later than originally scheduled.
meanings.sent1: She postpones the meeting until next week.
meanings.sent2: The rain postpones the outdoor party.
meanings.sent3: The cat postpones its nap to play with a toy.
meanings.sent4: The sun postpones its appearance behind the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The teacher postpones the test to allow more study time.

meanings.definition: Delay or put off an event or action.
meanings.sent1: He postpones his dentist appointment for a week.
meanings.sent2: The traffic postpones our arrival at the airport.
meanings.sent3: The dog postpones going outside by pretending to be asleep.
meanings.sent4: The moon postpones its rise, hiding behind the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The chef postpones serving the meal to ensure it is perfect.
